titles.title: Waiving points of order against consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 6) to ensure jobs for our future with secure, affordable, and reliable energy.
Waiving points of order against consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 6) to ensure jobs for our future with secure, affordable, and reliable energy.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-200, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report is considered as read.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 76.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 394.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 6, the Energy Policy Act of 2005.
